snippet: A 300-mile highway in Calabria has yet to be finished after decades of work, and critics see it as the rotten fruit of a jobs-for-votes culture.
abstract: Italy’s A3 highway, begun in the 1960s and still not finished, is seen as the embodiment of the failures of the Italian state; critics see it as the rotten fruit of a jobs-for-votes culture that, nurtured by organized crime that is endemic in southern Italy, has systematically defrauded the state while failing its citizens, leaving Calabria geographically and economically isolated.
lead_paragraph: A 300-mile highway in Calabria has yet to be finished after decades of work, and critics see it as the rotten fruit of a jobs-for-votes culture.

headline.seo: In Italy, Calabria Is Drained by Corruption
headline.main: Corruption Is Seen as a Drain on Italy’s South
headline.print_headline: Corruption Seen As Steady Drain On Italy's South
